segments.text: What do you think we need to do to get our new branch office running well ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: First , I'd make sure that we have a good , local , corporate lawyer . He or she will know all the local laws and regulations .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That ’ s very important . A friend recommended a good law firm to me . We ’ ll need someone to hire staff .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think that we should send one of our HR people to do that . I don ’ t think we should use an agency , because they won ’ t be familiar with the type of people we employ . Have we decide on the location of the branch office ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes . We have . We chose the location in the northeast of the city , not too far from the airport and on the edge of the CBD .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Why didn ’ t we choose an office in the CBD ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The offices there were too expensive . Have we negotiated any contracts yet ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . We ’ Ve signed two contracts with companies that we already do work for in other countries . We hope to sign another three this month .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: When will the branch office open ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Hopefully next month . Everything is a little rushed . We should be able to set up our branch office and expand our business quickly .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Has and advertising campaign been prepared ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , it has . We ’ re going to target the business community through business magazine .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I made plenty of business contract on my last visit and through the embassy . We should be able to get plenty of customers .
segments.speaker: S1
